content.description: This problem is face climbing directly across from Cavers Problem. This route gets neglected because it is tall and has some vegetation growing out of it. I have never topped out on this one, it's high and vegetated... So, if you are wondering how the top out is climb Offset Corner and investigate the top out. Also the fall is not good for two reasons 1. the height and 2. the rock that comes out of the ground by the base of this face. This is a big line, stay safe on it!

When walking towards the Black Jack Boulders from telephone pole #37 this will be one of the first problems you see. It is identified as a dirty dihedral, the top is becoming overtaken by lichen again. This problem is nothing special, but as you climb you will find a few awkward moves but do not forget to stem, this will make you be able to run up this climb, it is not overly memorable but if you decided to do it have fun. And have a spotter because it is high at the top, don't let the height deter you.
content.location: First route your see walking towards entrance boulders, it is dirty, tall, and obvious.

content.description: A fun, albeit short lived, one or two mover that avoids the heinous pinch on "Born to Thrutch" while still enjoying the fun holds.Start sitting as per "Born to Thrutch" on the crimps or small pockets, and cross up to a decent crimp before unwinding to the jug that starts "Dirty Diana". Do a few more moves on jugs before topping out in the jungle above, or drop back to your pad and move on.

Avoiding the barn door will get you through this one. 

  Once off the ground less than obvious crux moves give way to an easy top out.
content.location: One of the first problems when entering from pole 37. Climb the arete and cleaned face just right of Offset Corner

content.description:
This route is dirty, well maybe thats an understatement... 

  Anyway it is a lot of fun on huge jugs. Start sitting on two huge rails and move up and right to the big holds. Keep moving up on big dirty holds. Top out straight up. The crux is the first move because even though the holds are big they are the smallest on the route.  

  I will try to clean this in the spring or sometime sooner if possible.
content.location: This route is on the same face as Bobby's Problem but on the left most part of the wall.  This face faces up hill, the start is on a rail with the right hand and a good rail/bump with the left hand. Walk off the top to the right, a little vegetated down climbing is part of the down climb.

content.description: A short, powerful, crimpy problem ending with a dynamic move to a big friendly hold. Worth trying if you've already done Bobby's Problem and your friends are still working it.Start sitting on a rounded quartz crimp for the left hand and a small slot crimp for the right. Use the perpetually wet jug foot and another foot out right to get off the ground. Make a couple powerful moves to gain a cool mini pinch then fire for the massive holds on "Dirty Diana". Mantle up on the jugs and top out in the jungle or downclimb. Or just drop off.They can't all be classics.
content.location: Far left end of the face that holds "Bobby's Problem". Down and right of "Dirty Diana".

content.description: Sit start on left hand jug and a right hand crimp. Make a long move to a good pocket, move you feet around and get into the business. Move left hand to a crimp and move right hand up right to a three finger crimp. From here traverse left to the quartz jug in the crack and tackle the high but safe top out.
content.location: On the backside (north) of the entrance boulder, powerful face, left of the arete.

content.description:
Start sitting below the arete with the right hand on a juggy shelf at 4 feet and the left hand on a small gaston crimp/edge. Work your way up the arete to a long move to a small pinch at mid height. Finish out with a few more longish moves on decent holds to a juggy hold at the lip and an easy top out. 

  Good movement on high quality rock!
content.location: Located just to the right of 'Bobby's Problem'. It climbs the obvious arete.

content.description: This route is fun easy route that climbs flakes to the top. These flakes may break so climb easy on them. Sit start on a good crimp one foot right of the tree and climb straight up, using the flakes and a fun undercling. The crux is either the start or the top out but the cruxes are not overly challenging.
content.location: This route is on the trailside face of the entrance boulder, as you were walking toward Vader. This starts just right of the last tree on that face, on a good crimp. Walk of the easiest way you can find.

content.description: This is a large house-sized block with several highballs and several old-school classics that receive a lot of attention.
